intro: Chupalon guianense, commonly known as the Guianese chupalon, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. Its leaves are palmate, meaning they are divided into several lobes that radiate from a single point. Chupalon guianense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
